subject: Design
title: Right-Click Context Menus: Hidden Power
description: A 60-second lesson on Right-Click Context Menus: Hidden Power.

hook.text: Most people only use the left mouse button. The right one hides a secret world of options.

buildup.text: Context menus show only actions relevant to what you clicked â€” cutting clutter dramatically.

discovery.text: This is progressive disclosure: hiding complexity until the user asks for it.

twist.text: Power users rely on right-click for speed. Novices don't even know it exists. Both are fine.

climax.text: Context menus solve the hardest UI problem: serving beginners and experts at the same time.

punchline.text: Great interfaces have layers. You only peel what you need.

quiz.question: What UI principle do context menus demonstrate?
